editorialSummary.text: Sleek 89th-floor observation deck offering sweeping, 360º city views & a souvenir shop.

text.text:
Amazing experience at Taipei 101!
The building is iconic and the view from the top is stunning. The elevator was super fast—I felt my ears pop a bit! Totally worth it for the amazing view of Taipei. The tuned mass damper was also interesting to see. A must-visit when in Taiwan!

originalText.text:
Amazing experience at Taipei 101!
The building is iconic and the view from the top is stunning. The elevator was super fast—I felt my ears pop a bit! Totally worth it for the amazing view of Taipei. The tuned mass damper was also interesting to see. A must-visit when in Taiwan!

text.text:
A must-see attraction in Taipei! The Taipei 101 Observatory offers breathtaking views of the city, and on clear days, you can see all the way to the surrounding mountains. The elevator ride is impressively fast, and once you reach the top, the panoramic views are absolutely stunning.

There’s also an informative exhibition about the building’s construction and the technology behind it, including the massive wind damper that helps stabilize the tower during storms and earthquakes.

The observation deck is spacious, with plenty of spots for photos, and the staff are friendly and helpful. It can get crowded during peak times, so it’s a good idea to visit early in the day.

A fantastic experience for tourists and locals alike—don’t miss it when in Taipei!

text.text: Nice experience for a not-too-bad price. We bought tickets at the counter during a weekday afternoon with no line for purchase, and were at the observatory within 10 minutes. A nice way to chill and take in the sights of the panoramic view of the city especially during the sunset. Make sure not to miss the tuned mass damper which is a really cool feat of engineering.

originalText.text: Nice experience for a not-too-bad price. We bought tickets at the counter during a weekday afternoon with no line for purchase, and were at the observatory within 10 minutes. A nice way to chill and take in the sights of the panoramic view of the city especially during the sunset. Make sure not to miss the tuned mass damper which is a really cool feat of engineering.

text.text:
As an observation deck and tall towers go, Taipei 101  is up there with the best (if not the best).

I have been to many around the world, but this one is spectacular. There are so many things to see and do up there, different installations to interact with. It's really spacious and was not so busy on a weekend!

We loved being able to see the Tuned Mass Damper which are normally of limits in many other towers.

The views of Taipei from the 89th-floor are incredible (360 degrees) and the elevator ride up is one of the world's fastest in the world, reaching the 89th-floor observatory in just 37 seconds for an unforgettable city view.

originalText.text:
As an observation deck and tall towers go, Taipei 101  is up there with the best (if not the best).

I have been to many around the world, but this one is spectacular. There are so many things to see and do up there, different installations to interact with. It's really spacious and was not so busy on a weekend!

We loved being able to see the Tuned Mass Damper which are normally of limits in many other towers.

The views of Taipei from the 89th-floor are incredible (360 degrees) and the elevator ride up is one of the world's fastest in the world, reaching the 89th-floor observatory in just 37 seconds for an unforgettable city view.

text.text:
What an amazing experience at Taipei 101! The NT600 ticket was totally worth it — it includes access to the observatory and some discount coupons for shops on the 89th floor. I loved the interactive exhibits, especially the personalized Coca-Cola bottle station (yes, you can print your name on it! By buying coca cola from their souvenir shop behind. and the massive golden damper ball with fun robot mascots around it.
The Doraemon corner was super cute and perfect for photos — just don’t touch! The views from the top are unbeatable, and sipping Milksha bubble tea with the glowing Taipei 101 neon sign behind me was a moment I’ll never forget.
Great for solo travelers, super IG-worthy, and very well organized. Highly recommend!

Great for solo travelers, super IG-worthy, and very well organized. Highly recommend!

description:
Step into the Taipei 101 Observatory, a breathtaking scenic spot perched on the 89th floor of the iconic Taipei 101 skyscraper.  As you ascend in one of the world's fastest elevators – a thrilling experience in itself – the anticipation builds.  The glass-walled cabin provides a glimpse of the city's ascent, transforming from a sprawling metropolis into a miniature landscape.

Upon arrival, you're greeted by a panoramic vista that unfolds in a 360-degree sweep.  The cityscape stretches out before you, a dazzling tapestry of shimmering skyscrapers, verdant parks, and winding rivers. On a clear day, the mountains surrounding Taipei rise majestically in the distance, their peaks piercing the azure sky.  The vibrant energy of the city below is palpable, yet from this vantage point, you feel a sense of serene detachment, a bird's-eye view of bustling life.

The observatory itself is spacious and well-designed, offering multiple viewing platforms to ensure everyone gets the perfect shot.  Interactive exhibits offer insights into the engineering marvel that is Taipei 101, highlighting the building's construction and the ingenious tuned mass damper – a giant, gleaming sphere that helps stabilize
